meanings.sent1: I had to make some recalculations to ensure the total was correct.
meanings.sent2: After making some recalculations, I realized I had made a mistake in my math homework.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's recalculations of the test scores brought a smile to everyone's face.
meanings.sent4: Her recalculations of the recipe turned a bland dish into a flavorful masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's recalculations of the data revealed a groundbreaking discovery.

meanings.definition: The process of reevaluating a previous calculation.
meanings.sent1: The recalculations of the budget showed we had overspent.
meanings.sent2: We had to do some recalculations to figure out where the error occurred.
meanings.sent3: The robot's recalculations of its route led to a hilarious mix-up.
meanings.sent4: His recalculations of the project timeline saved us from missing the deadline.
meanings.sent5: The detective's recalculations of the evidence pointed to a different suspect.
